column3: question

column2: Please specify channel electrode choice in this section, inclusion and excusion criteria and channel montages analysed.
column3: How did you decide which channels would be included/excluded from analysis
column4: For example,  2. include exclusion of O2 after discovering loose caps cause faulty contacts over this region;  3. select channels where sensory peaks are most cleanly detected (regardless of experimental condition), prior to comparing peaks across conditions 4. after viewing the ERP per condition, selection of channels showing largest difference in time regions of interest
column6: a priori selection of particular channels | a priori criteria for inclusion/exclusion | inclusion/exclusion decisions made after recording | all channels are used for measurement and analysis | other

column3: A-priori channel inclusion/exclusion type
column4: Reason to include/exclude this specific combination of electrodes in the main analysis.  For example,  1. previous N400 literature shows electrode X,  and Y  For example, 2. this effect is predicted to appear over the frontal pole. Specify further details in Further Clarification column (e.g. references to papers)
column6: same channels as in previous literature | based on previous literature, but not exact replication | theory driven novel channel selection | other

column3: Literature references in which this exact channel selection was used, separated by semicolon and space
Literature references for a-priori selection plus reasons for deviation/combination of references, separated by semicolon and space
Theory behind a-priori channel selection (including implementation of regions, thresholds etc, and references if relevant)
column4: Please describe the theory your decision was based on, and how you implemented it in terms of regions, thresholds etc. You may note down any relevant references here.

column3: Describe your a-priori channel selection other than those listed
Describe your a-priori criteria for channel inclusion/exclusion
column4: For example, << fictional >> James uses a threshold of 5 microvolts for 2nd peak in pnp complex any channel that does not detect this signal is excluded.

column3: After recording, how did you decide which electrodes/channels to include/exclude?
column6: equipment malfunction | observed signal/noise | results dependent

column3: Describe your equipment malfunction
Describe your signal/noise dependent inclusion/exclusion thresholds for channels
column6: visual inspection | thresholds for inclusion/exclusion decided after recording | other

column3: Describe the visual inspection process for signal/noise for channel inclusion/exclusion
column4: For example, 'channels visually identified as noisy at the time of recording were excluded'; 'channels that were identified as unstable, (i.e., frequently losing contact at the time of recording) were excluded' 'after calculation of the grant average, channels that do not show a clear PNP complex were excluded'

column3: Describe your thresholds for channel inclusion/exclusion decided after recording
column4: For example, if a single electrode in a high density net deviates by more than X% from 4 surrounding electrodes, then excluded

column3: Describe your channel selection decided after recording based on observed signal/noise, other than those listed
Describe how you decided on your included/excluded channels on the basis of the conditions you plan to statistically compare (e.g., channels with largest difference between critical conditions)
Describe what process, other than listed, did you use when deciding on channels to use in the analysis.
If you applied multiple decisions about channel inclusion/exclusion, describe the order you applied them here.
Did you reconstruct the signal from any missing/excluded/noisy channel(s)?
In what cases was reconstruction applied?
column6: all data | subset of participants | subset of trials | subset of trials in a subset of participants

column3: Explain your missing data reconstruction implemented for all participants and all trials
column4: Data from all participants were experienced the same missing data, and the same reconstruction was applied to all recordings for all participants. For example,  'Due to an electrical fault in the amplifier, no signal was detected from T3, so T3 was reconstructed from the average of the two nearest electrodes',

column3: Explain your missing data reconstruction for a subset of participants (including order of operations, if relevant)
column4: Data from some recording sessions or some participants was reconstructed but not others. For example, in one participant, electrode FP1 detatched and was replaced by the signal from FP2

column3: Explain your missing data reconstruction for a subset of trials (including order of operations, if relevant)
column4: Data from some some trials was reconstructed but not others. For example, in 10% of trials electrode FP1 was noisy and was replaced by the signal from FP2. This problem affected 4 participants.

column3: Explain your missing data reconstruction for a subset of trials in a subset of participants, including order of operations
How many channels were selected/remained for analysis using this channel selection/exclusion method?
List all channel locations included in the analysis using this selection/exclusion method, separated by a semicolon and a space.
